subject: More madness from Twitpic: indemnification from claims related to user content
text:
Twitpic terms are very, very interesting:
        You agree to indemnify and hold Twitpic, its officers and
        employees exempt from any claim or demand, including reasonable
        attorneys' fees, made by any third party due to or arising out
        of Content you submit, transmit, post or otherwise make
        available through Twitpic. 
        http://www.twitpic.com/terms.do
        
This is the kind of clause you usually see in contracts between 2
companies, etc. It is the first time I see something like this in
general ToS. Have you seen them elsewhere? What do you think?
-- 
Hugo Roy 
  French Coordinator, FSFE       chat: hugo@jabber.fsfe.org
  www.fsfe.org/about/roy         mobile: +336 08 74 13 41
